name: consul
description: A Pulumi package for creating and managing consul resources.
attribution: This Pulumi package is based on the [`consul` Terraform Provider](https://github.com/hashicorp/terraform-provider-consul).

nodejs.packageDescription: A Pulumi package for creating and managing consul resources.
nodejs.readme:
> This provider is a derived work of the [Terraform Provider](https://github.com/hashicorp/terraform-provider-consul)
> distributed under [MPL 2.0](https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/MPL/2.0/). If you encounter a bug or missing feature,
> first check the [`pulumi-consul` repo](https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-consul/issues); however, if that doesn't turn up anything,
> please consult the source [`terraform-provider-consul` repo](https://github.com/hashicorp/terraform-provider-consul/issues).

address.description: The HTTP(S) API address of the agent to use. Defaults to "127.0.0.1:8500".

authJwt.description: Authenticates to Consul using a JWT authentication method.

caFile.description: A path to a PEM-encoded certificate authority used to verify the remote agent's certificate.

caPath.description:
A path to a directory of PEM-encoded certificate authority files to use to check the authenticity of client and server
connections. Can also be specified with the `CONSUL_CAPATH` environment variable.

caPem.description: PEM-encoded certificate authority used to verify the remote agent's certificate.

certFile.description: A path to a PEM-encoded certificate provided to the remote agent; requires use of `key_file` or `key_pem`.

certPem.description: PEM-encoded certificate provided to the remote agent; requires use of `key_file` or `key_pem`.

datacenter.description: The datacenter to use. Defaults to that of the agent.

headers.description:
A configuration block, described below, that provides additional headers to be sent along with all requests to the
Consul server. This block can be specified multiple times.

httpAuth.description:
HTTP Basic Authentication credentials to be used when communicating with Consul, in the format of either `user` or
`user:pass`. This may also be specified using the `CONSUL_HTTP_AUTH` environment variable.

insecureHttps.description:
Boolean value to disable SSL certificate verification; setting this value to true is not recommended for production use.
Only use this with scheme set to "https".

keyFile.description: A path to a PEM-encoded private key, required if `cert_file` or `cert_pem` is specified.

keyPem.description: PEM-encoded private key, required if `cert_file` or `cert_pem` is specified.

scheme.description: The URL scheme of the agent to use ("http" or "https"). Defaults to "http".

token.description:
The ACL token to use by default when making requests to the agent. Can also be specified with `CONSUL_HTTP_TOKEN` or
`CONSUL_TOKEN` as an environment variable.

authMethod.description: The name of the auth method to use for login.

bearerToken.description: The bearer token to present to the auth method during login for authentication purposes. For the Kubernetes auth method this is a [Service Account Token (JWT)](https://kubernetes.io/docs/reference/access-authn-authz/authentication/#service-account-tokens).

meta.description: Specifies arbitrary KV metadata linked to the token. Can be useful to track origins.

name.description: The name of the header.

bindNamespace.description: If the namespace rule's `selector` matches then this is used to control the namespace where the token is created.

selector.description: Specifies the expression used to match this namespace rule against valid identities returned from an auth method validation.

name.description: The name of node, workload identity or service.

datacenter.description: Specifies the node's datacenter.

datacenters.description: The datacenters the effective policy is valid within. When no datacenters are provided the effective policy is valid in all datacenters including those which do not yet exist but may in the future.
Specifies the datacenters the effective policy is valid within.

templateName.description: The name of the templated policies.

datacenter.description: The datacenter of the node.

The address of the service. Defaults to the
node address.

id.description: The ID of the service. Defaults to the `name`.

name.description: The name of the service

tags.description:
A list of values that are opaque to Consul,
but can be used to distinguish between services or nodes.

defaults.description: Specifies configurations that set default upstream settings. For information about overriding the default configurations for in for individual upstreams, refer to UpstreamConfig.Overrides.

overrides.description: Specifies options that override the default upstream configurations for individual upstreams.

balanceOutboundConnections.description: Sets the strategy for allocating outbound connections from upstreams across Envoy proxy threads.

limits.description: Map that specifies a set of limits to apply to when connecting upstream services.

meshGateways.description: Specifies the default mesh gateway mode field for all upstreams.

passiveHealthChecks.description: Map that specifies a set of rules that enable Consul to remove hosts from the upstream cluster that are unreachable or that return errors.

protocol.description: Specifies the default protocol for the service.

maxConcurrentRequests.description: Specifies the maximum number of concurrent requests.

maxConnections.description: Specifies the maximum number of connections a service instance can establish against the upstream.

maxPendingRequests.description: Specifies the maximum number of requests that are queued while waiting for a connection to establish.

baseEjectionTime.description: Specifies the minimum amount of time that an ejected host must remain outside the cluster before rejoining.

enforcingConsecutive5xx.description: Specifies a percentage that indicates how many times out of 100 that Consul ejects the host when it detects an outlier status.

maxEjectionPercent.description: Specifies the maximum percentage of an upstream cluster that Consul ejects when the proxy reports an outlier.

maxFailures.description: Specifies the number of consecutive failures allowed per check interval. If exceeded, Consul removes the host from the load balancer.

providers.description: Specifies the names of one or more previously configured JWT provider configuration entries, which include the information necessary to validate a JSON web token.

name.description: Specifies the name of a JWT provider defined in the Name field of the jwt-provider configuration entry.

verifyClaims.description: Specifies additional token information to verify beyond what is configured in the JWT provider configuration entry.

paths.description: Specifies the path to the claim in the JSON web token.

value.description: Specifies the value to match on when verifying the the claim designated in path.

action.description: Specifies the action to take when the source sends traffic to the destination service.

description.description: Specifies a description of the intention.

name.description: Specifies the name of the source that the intention allows or denies traffic from.

namespace.description: Specifies the traffic source namespace that the intention allows or denies traffic from.

partition.description: Specifies the name of an admin partition that the intention allows or denies traffic from.

peer.description: Specifies the name of a peered Consul cluster that the intention allows or denies traffic from

permissions.description: Specifies a list of permissions for L7 traffic sources. The list contains one or more actions and a set of match criteria for each action.

precedence.description: The Precedence field contains a read-only integer. Consul generates the value based on name configurations for the source and destination services.

samenessGroup.description: Specifies the name of a sameness group that the intention allows or denies traffic from.

type.description: Specifies the type of destination service that the configuration entry applies to.

action.description: Specifies the action to take when the source sends traffic to the destination service.

https.description: Specifies a set of HTTP-specific match criteria.

headers.description: Specifies a header name and matching criteria for HTTP request headers.

methods.description: Specifies a list of HTTP methods.

pathExact.description: Specifies an exact path to match on the HTTP request path.

pathPrefix.description: Specifies a path prefix to match on the HTTP request path.

pathRegex.description: Defines a regular expression to match on the HTTP request path.

exact.description: Specifies a value for the header key set in the Name field. If the request header value matches the Exact value, Consul applies the permission.

invert.description: Inverts the matching logic configured in the Header.

name.description: Specifies the name of a JWT provider defined in the Name field of the jwt-provider configuration entry.

prefix.description: Specifies a prefix value for the header key set in the Name field.

present.description: Enables a match if the header configured in the Name field appears in the request. Consul matches on any value as long as the header key appears in the request.

regex.description: Specifies a regular expression pattern as the value for the header key set in the Name field.

suffix.description: Specifies a suffix value for the header key set in the Name field.

datacenters.description: Specifies an ordered list of datacenters at the failover location to attempt connections to during a failover scenario. When Consul cannot establish a connection with the first datacenter in the list, it proceeds sequentially until establishing a connection with another datacenter.

namespace.description: Specifies the namespace at the failover location where the failover services are deployed.

samenessGroup.description: Specifies the sameness group at the failover location where the failover services are deployed.

service.description: Specifies the name of the service to resolve at the failover location during a failover scenario.

serviceSubset.description: Specifies the name of a subset of service instances to resolve at the failover location during a failover scenario.

targets.description: Specifies a fixed list of failover targets to try during failover. This list can express complicated failover scenarios.

datacenter.description: Specifies the WAN federated datacenter to use for the failover target. If empty, the current datacenter is used.

namespace.description: Specifies the namespace at the failover location where the failover services are deployed.

partition.description: Specifies the admin partition within the same datacenter to use for the failover target. If empty, the default partition is used.

peer.description: Specifies the destination cluster peer to resolve the target service name from.

service.description: Specifies the name of the service to resolve at the failover location during a failover scenario.

serviceSubset.description: Specifies the name of a subset of service instances to resolve at the failover location during a failover scenario.

hashPolicies.description: Specifies a list of hash policies to use for hashing load balancing algorithms. Consul evaluates hash policies individually and combines them so that identical lists result in the same hash.

leastRequestConfigs.description: Specifies configuration for the least*request policy type.

policy.description: Specifies the type of load balancing policy for selecting a host.

ringHashConfigs.description: Specifies configuration for the ring*hash policy type.

cookieConfigs.description: Specifies additional configuration options for the cookie hash policy type.

field.description: Specifies the attribute type to hash on. You cannot specify the Field parameter if SourceIP is also configured.

fieldValue.description: Specifies the value to hash, such as a header name, cookie name, or a URL query parameter name.

sourceIp.description: Determines if the hash type should be source IP address.

terminal.description: Determines if Consul should stop computing the hash when multiple hash policies are present.

path.description: Specifies the path to set for the cookie.

session.description: Directs Consul to generate a session cookie with no expiration.

ttl.description: Specifies the TTL for generated cookies. Cannot be specified for session cookies.

maximumRingSize.description: Determines the maximum number of entries in the hash ring.

minimumRingSize.description: Determines the minimum number of entries in the hash ring.

datacenter.description: Specifies the datacenter at the redirect’s destination that resolves local upstream requests.

namespace.description: Specifies the namespace at the redirect’s destination that resolves local upstream requests.

partition.description: Specifies the admin partition at the redirect’s destination that resolves local upstream requests.

peer.description: Specifies the cluster with an active cluster peering connection at the redirect’s destination that resolves local upstream requests.

samenessGroup.description: Specifies the sameness group at the redirect’s destination that resolves local upstream requests.

service.description: Specifies the name of a service at the redirect’s destination that resolves local upstream requests.

serviceSubset.description: Specifies the name of a subset of services at the redirect’s destination that resolves local upstream requests. If empty, the default subset is used. If specified, you must also specify at least one of the following in the same Redirect map: Service, Namespace, andDatacenter.

filter.description: Specifies an expression that filters the DNS elements of service instances that belong to the subset. If empty, all healthy instances of a service are returned.

name.description: Name of subset.

onlyPassing.description: Determines if instances that return a warning from a health check are allowed to resolve a request. When set to false, instances with passing and warning states are considered healthy. When set to true, only instances with a passing health check state are considered healthy.

destination.description: Specifies the target service to route matching requests to, as well as behavior for the request to follow when routed.

match.description: Describes a set of criteria that Consul compares incoming L7 traffic with.

idleTimeout.description: Specifies the total amount of time permitted for the request stream to be idle.

namespace.description: Specifies the Consul namespace to resolve the service from instead of the current namespace.

numRetries.description: Specifies the number of times to retry the request when a retry condition occurs.

partition.description: Specifies the Consul admin partition to resolve the service from instead of the current partition.

prefixRewrite.description: Specifies rewrites to the HTTP request path before proxying it to its final destination.

requestHeaders.description: Specifies a set of HTTP-specific header modification rules applied to requests routed with the service router.

requestTimeout.description: Specifies the total amount of time permitted for the entire downstream request to be processed, including retry attempts.

responseHeaders.description: Specifies a set of HTTP-specific header modification rules applied to responses routed with the service router.

retryOnConnectFailure.description: Specifies that connection failure errors that trigger a retry request.

retryOnStatusCodes.description: Specifies a list of integers for HTTP response status codes that trigger a retry request.

retryOns.description: Specifies a list of conditions for Consul to retry requests based on the response from an upstream service.

service.description: Specifies the name of the service to resolve.

serviceSubset.description: Specifies a named subset of the given service to resolve instead of the one defined as that service's `default_subset` in the service resolver configuration entry.

removes.description: Defines a list of headers to remove.

exact.description: Specifies that a request matches when the header with the given name is this exact value.

invert.description: Specifies that the logic for the HTTP header match should be inverted.

name.description: Specifies the name of the HTTP header to match.

prefix.description: Specifies that a request matches when the header with the given name has this prefix.

present.description: Specifies that a request matches when the value in the `name` argument is present anywhere in the HTTP header.

regex.description: Specifies that a request matches when the header with the given name matches this regular expression.

suffix.description: Specifies that a request matches when the header with the given name has this suffix.

namespace.description: Specifies the namespace to use in the FQDN when resolving the service.

partition.description: Specifies the admin partition to use in the FQDN when resolving the service.

requestHeaders.description: Specifies a set of HTTP-specific header modification rules applied to requests routed with the service split. You cannot configure request headers if the listener protocol is set to `tcp`.

responseHeaders.description: Specifies a set of HTTP-specific header modification rules applied to responses routed with the service split. You cannot configure request headers if the listener protocol is set to `tcp`.

service.description: Specifies the name of the service to resolve.

serviceSubset.description: Specifies a subset of the service to resolve. A service subset assigns a name to a specific subset of discoverable service instances within a datacenter, such as `version2` or `canary`. All services have an unnamed default subset that returns all healthy instances.

weight.description: Specifies the percentage of traffic sent to the set of service instances specified in the `service` field. Each weight must be a floating integer between `0` and `100`. The smallest representable value is `.01`. The sum of weights across all splits must add up to `100`.

add.description: Map of one or more key-value pairs. Defines a set of key-value pairs to add to the header. Use header names as the keys. Header names are not case-sensitive. If header values with the same name already exist, the value is appended and Consul applies both headers.

removes.description: Defines an list of headers to remove. Consul removes only headers containing exact matches. Header names are not case-sensitive.

set.description: Map of one or more key-value pairs. Defines a set of key-value pairs to add to the request header or to replace existing header values with. Use header names as the keys. Header names are not case-sensitive. If header values with the same names already exist, Consul replaces the header values.

removes.description: Defines an list of headers to remove. Consul removes only headers containing exact matches. Header names are not case-sensitive.

set.description: Map of one or more key-value pairs. Defines a set of key-value pairs to add to the request header or to replace existing header values with. Use header names as the keys. Header names are not case-sensitive. If header values with the same names already exist, Consul replaces the header values.

data tag information, if any.
* [`name`](https://www.consul.io/docs/agent/http/catalog.html#Node) - The name
of the Consul node.
* [`address`](https://www.consul.io/docs/agent/http/catalog.html#Address) - The
IP address the node is advertising to the Consul cluster.
* [`tagged_addresses`](https://www.consul.io/docs/agent/http/catalog.html#TaggedAddresses) -
List of explicit LAN and WAN IP addresses for the agent.

nodeId.description:
The Node ID of the Consul agent advertising the service.
* [`node_meta`](https://www.consul.io/docs/agent/http/catalog.html#Meta) - Node
meta data tag information, if any.
* [`node_name`](https://www.consul.io/docs/agent/http/catalog.html#Node) - The
name of the Consul node.
* [`address`](https://www.consul.io/docs/agent/http/catalog.html#ServiceAddress) -
The IP address of the service.  If the `ServiceAddress` in the Consul catalog
is empty, this value is automatically populated with the `node_address` (the
`Address` in the Consul Catalog).
* [`enable_tag_override`](https://www.consul.io/docs/agent/http/catalog.html#ServiceEnableTagOverride) -
Whether service tags can be overridden on this service.
* [`id`](https://www.consul.io/docs/agent/http/catalog.html#ServiceID) - A
unique service instance identifier.
* [`name`](https://www.consul.io/docs/agent/http/catalog.html#ServiceName) - The
name of the service.
* [`port`](https://www.consul.io/docs/agent/http/catalog.html#ServicePort) -
Port number of the service.
* [`tagged_addresses`](https://www.consul.io/docs/agent/http/catalog.html#TaggedAddresses) -
List of explicit LAN and WAN IP addresses for the agent.
* [`tags`](https://www.consul.io/docs/agent/http/catalog.html#ServiceTags) -
List of tags for the service.
* [`meta`](https://www.consul.io/docs/agent/http/catalog.html#Meta) - Service meta
data tag information, if any.

When `true`, the default, allow responses from
Consul servers that are followers.

empty, the `datacenter` value found in the Consul agent that this provider is
configured to talk to.

role.description:
Role is always `"server"` since only Consul servers can participate
in network areas.

rtt.description:
An estimated network round trip time from the server answering the
query to the given server, in nanoseconds. This is computed using network
coordinates.

status.description:
The current health status of the node, as determined by the
network area distributed failure detector. This will be `"alive"`, `"leaving"`,
or `"failed"`. A `"failed"` status means that other servers are not able to
probe this server over its server RPC interface.

consul:index/aclTokenPolicyAttachment:Ac.description:
## Import

`consul_acl_token_policy_attachment` can be imported. This is especially useful to manage the

policies attached to the anonymous and the master tokens with Terraform:

```sh
$ pulumi import consul:index/aclTokenPolicyAttachment:AclTokenPolicyAttachment anonymous 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000002:policy_name
```

```sh
$ pulumi import consul:index/aclTokenPolicyAttachment:AclTokenPolicyAttachment master-token 624d94ca-bc5c-f960-4e83-0a609cf588be:policy_name
```

consul:index/certificateAuthority:Certif.description:
The `consul.CertificateAuthority` resource can be used to manage the configuration of the Certificate Authority used by [Consul Connect](https://www.consul.io/docs/connect/ca).

> **Note:** The keys in the `config` argument must be using Camel case.

## Import

```sh
$ pulumi import consul:index/certificateAuthority:CertificateAuthority connect connect-ca
```

the given path prefix.

consul:index/namespacePolicyAttachment:N.description:
## Import

`consul_namespace_policy_attachment` can be imported. This is especially useful
to manage the policies attached to the `default` namespace:

```sh
$ pulumi import consul:index/namespacePolicyAttachment:NamespacePolicyAttachment default default:policy_name
```

ignoreCheckIds.description: Specifies a list of check IDs that should be ignored when filtering unhealthy instances. This is mostly useful in an emergency or as a temporary measure when a health check is found to be unreliable. Being able to ignore it in centrally-defined queries can be simpler than de-registering the check as an interim solution until the check can be fixed.

onlyPassing.description: When `true`, the prepared query will only return nodes with passing health checks in the result.

consul:index/getCatalogNodes:getCatalogN.deprecationMessage: getCatalogNodes has been deprecated in favor of getNodes
consul:index/getCatalogNodes:getCatalogN.description:
The `consul.getNodes` data source returns a list of Consul nodes that have
been registered with the Consul cluster in a given datacenter.  By specifying a
different datacenter in the `query_options` it is possible to retrieve a list of
nodes from a different WAN-attached Consul datacenter.

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getCatalogNodes.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getCatalogNodes.

datacenter.description: The datacenter the keys are being read from to.

id.description: The provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.

nodeIds.description: A list of the Consul node IDs.

nodeNames.description: A list of the Consul node names.

nodes.description:
A list of nodes and details about each Consul agent.  The list of
per-node attributes is detailed below.

consul:index/getCatalogService:getCatalo.deprecationMessage: getCatalogService has been deprecated in favor of getService
consul:index/getCatalogService:getCatalo.description:
`consul.Service` provides details about a specific Consul service in a
given datacenter.  The results include a list of nodes advertising the specified
service, the node's IP address, port number, node ID, etc.  By specifying a
different datacenter in the `query_options` it is possible to retrieve a list of
services from a different WAN-attached Consul datacenter.

This data source is different from the `consul.getServices` (plural) data
source, which provides a summary of the current Consul services.

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getCatalogService.

datacenter.description:
The Consul datacenter to query.  Defaults to the
same value found in `query_options` parameter specified below, or if that is
empty, the `datacenter` value found in the Consul agent that this provider is
configured to talk to.

filter.description:
A filter expression to refine the query, see https://www.consul.io/api-docs/features/filtering
and https://www.consul.io/api-docs/catalog#filtering-1.

name.description: The service name to select.

tag.description:
A single tag that can be used to filter the list of nodes
to return based on a single matching tag..

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getCatalogService.

datacenter.description: The datacenter the keys are being read from to.

id.description: The provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.

name.description: The name of the service

services.description:
A list of nodes and details about each endpoint advertising a
service.  Each element in the list is a map of attributes that correspond to
each individual node.  The list of per-node attributes is detailed below.

tag.description: The name of the tag used to filter the list of nodes in `service`.

consul:index/getCatalogServices:getCatal.deprecationMessage: getCatalogServices has been deprecated in favor of getServices
consul:index/getCatalogServices:getCatal.description:
The `consul.getServices` data source returns a list of Consul services that
have been registered with the Consul cluster in a given datacenter.  By
specifying a different datacenter in the `query_options` it is possible to
retrieve a list of services from a different WAN-attached Consul datacenter.

This data source is different from the `consul.Service` (singular) data
source, which provides a detailed response about a specific Consul service.

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getCatalogServices.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getCatalogServices.

datacenter.description: The datacenter the keys are being read from to.

id.description: The provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.

tags.description:
A map of the tags found for each service.  If more than one service
shares the same tag, unique service names will be joined by whitespace (this
is the inverse of `services` and can be used to lookup the services that match
a single tag).

consul:index/getDatacenters:getDatacente.description:
The `consul.getDatacenters` data source returns the list of all knwown Consul
datacenters.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getDatacenters.

datacenters.description:
The list of datacenters known. The datacenters will be sorted
in ascending order based on the estimated median round trip time from the server
to the servers in that datacenter.

Specifies the common prefix shared by all keys
that will be read by this data source instance. In most cases, this will

consul:index/getNodes:getNodes.description:
The `consul.getNodes` data source returns a list of Consul nodes that have
been registered with the Consul cluster in a given datacenter.  By specifying a
different datacenter in the `query_options` it is possible to retrieve a list of
nodes from a different WAN-attached Consul datacenter.

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getNodes.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getNodes.

datacenter.description: The datacenter the keys are being read from to.

id.description: The provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.

nodeIds.description: A list of the Consul node IDs.

nodeNames.description: A list of the Consul node names.

nodes.description:
A list of nodes and details about each Consul agent.  The list of
per-node attributes is detailed below.

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getPeering.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getPeering.

id.description: The provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getPeerings.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getPeerings.

id.description: The provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.

consul:index/getService:getService.description:
`consul.Service` provides details about a specific Consul service in a
given datacenter.  The results include a list of nodes advertising the specified
service, the node's IP address, port number, node ID, etc.  By specifying a
different datacenter in the `query_options` it is possible to retrieve a list of
services from a different WAN-attached Consul datacenter.

This data source is different from the `consul.getServices` (plural) data
source, which provides a summary of the current Consul services.

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getService.

datacenter.description:
The Consul datacenter to query.  Defaults to the
same value found in `query_options` parameter specified below, or if that is
empty, the `datacenter` value found in the Consul agent that this provider is
configured to talk to.

filter.description:
A filter expression to refine the query, see https://www.consul.io/api-docs/features/filtering
and https://www.consul.io/api-docs/catalog#filtering-1.

name.description: The service name to select.

tag.description:
A single tag that can be used to filter the list of nodes
to return based on a single matching tag..

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getService.

datacenter.description: The datacenter the keys are being read from to.

id.description: The provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.

name.description: The name of the service

services.description:
A list of nodes and details about each endpoint advertising a
service.  Each element in the list is a map of attributes that correspond to
each individual node.  The list of per-node attributes is detailed below.

tag.description: The name of the tag used to filter the list of nodes in `service`.

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getServiceHealth.

datacenter.description: The Consul datacenter to query.

filter.description:
A filter expression to refine the list of results, see
https://www.consul.io/api-docs/features/filtering and https://www.consul.io/api-docs/health#filtering-2.

name.description: The service name to select.

near.description:
Specifies a node name to sort the node list in ascending order
based on the estimated round trip time from that node.

nodeMeta.description:
Filter the results to nodes with the specified key/value
pairs.

passing.description:
Whether to return only nodes with all checks in the
passing state. Defaults to `true`.

tag.description:
A single tag that can be used to filter the list to return
based on a single matching tag.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getServiceHealth.

datacenter.description:
The datacenter in which the node is running.
* [`tagged_addresses`](https://www.consul.io/docs/agent/http/catalog.html#TaggedAddresses) -
List of explicit LAN and WAN IP addresses for the agent.

id.description: The provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.

name.description: The name of this health-check.

near.description: The node to which the result must be sorted to.

nodeMeta.description: The list of metadata to filter the nodes.

passing.description:
Whether to return only nodes with all checks in the
passing state.

results.description:
A list of entries and details about each endpoint advertising a
service.  Each element in the list has three attributes: `node`, `service` and
`checks`.  The list of the attributes of each one is detailed below.

tag.description: The name of the tag used to filter the list.

consul:index/getServices:getServices.description:
The `consul.getServices` data source returns a list of Consul services that
have been registered with the Consul cluster in a given datacenter.  By
specifying a different datacenter in the `query_options` it is possible to
retrieve a list of services from a different WAN-attached Consul datacenter.

This data source is different from the `consul.Service` (singular) data
source, which provides a detailed response about a specific Consul service.

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getServices.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getServices.

datacenter.description: The datacenter the keys are being read from to.

id.description: The provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.

tags.description:
A map of the tags found for each service.  If more than one service
shares the same tag, unique service names will be joined by whitespace (this
is the inverse of `services` and can be used to lookup the services that match
a single tag).
